casebody.data:
[*] NEAFIE against ACKERMAN’S Executors. [421] The action below was brought to recover a demand for ten hundred weight of rye meal, on a charge that it was sold to Neafie, by the testator, Ackerman, in April, 1796. No demand of payment, or promise to pay, was either proved or alleged. The defendant set up the statute of limitations in bar of the demand; this the justice overruled, and rendered judgment against Neafie. This being assigned for error, the court

ON CERTIORARI.

Reversed the judgment.
